OOps - I can see my message was a bit confusing.

The 8GB machine is a dual xeon linux/gentoo machine.

the XP issue is from my XP laptop. 

cheers

mark  

-----Original Message-----
From: Gordon Mohr (@Internet Archive)
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Sent: 7/5/04 9:00 PM
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Couple of minor things

I suspect this is a VM and OS issue.

The following suggests Windows processes will only ever get 2GB of
directly
addressable memory, and the Java heap will have to be less than that:

   http://www.petefreitag.com/item/140.cfm

And this Java HotSpot FAQ suggests the practical limit on Windows NT
(and
presumably XP) is aroun 1.5GB:

   http://java.sun.com/docs/hotspot/PerformanceFAQ.html#22

The limits would presumably would be different if you were in 64-bit
Windows
with a matching 64-bit VM; are you?

- Gordon @ IA


mark williamson wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> couple of minor things I have come across. 
> 
> Building on XP - I had a quick go at setting up a build environment on
> my XP laptop at the weekend and it wouldn't build - the
> XMLSettingsHandlerTest failed. Didn't look into it much because it
> wasn't urgent being able to build it on my laptop - any ideas?
> 
> The other one was I tried giving heritrix lots of memory with 
> JAVA_OPTS="-Xmx5120m" (its an 8GB machine). It did 
> 
> "Starting heritrix..." add a dot every second or so - I stopped it 
> after an hour or so. I've just given it a gig and it started fine.
> Is there a limit on -Xmx or have I missed something? 
> 
> cheers 
> 
> mark
